Title.evidence: EAGLE: A Randomised Controlled Trial to Reduce Anastomotic Leaks after Right Colectomy

Trial_Design.evidence: This multicentre, batched, cluster-randomized trial involved hospital teams as the unit of randomization.

Participants.evidence: The study was conducted in 332 hospital teams across 64 countries, with 39.2% from low- and middle-income countries.

Intervention.evidence: The intervention included an online educational module, risk stratification, an intraoperative checklist, and harmonized surgical techniques.

Objective.evidence: This study aimed to evaluate whether a standardized international quality improvement intervention could reduce anastomotic leak rates.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was the anastomotic leak rate within 30 days post-surgery.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Clusters were randomized using a stepped-wedge design.

Number_Randomised.evidence: A total of 355 hospital teams registered, with 332 included in the final analysis.

Number_Analysed.evidence: The primary analysis included 3039 of 3268 patients.

Result_Outcome.evidence: leak rates of 10.1% before and 9.6% after intervention (adjusted OR 0.87, 95% CI 0.59 to 1.30; P = 0.498).
